main event: A witness observed a silver, shiny, aluminum-like craft, the size of a small car, hovering over a farm in Crete, Illinois on August 22, 1960.
interesting points: The object was observed through an 8x scope and appeared to be hurtling through the sky at near sonic speed, with the surface reflecting light as it passed.
No visible appendages or means of propulsion could be observed on the object.
The witness estimated the object to be about 7 or 8 times larger than the head of a paper match.
The object disappeared slowly, with no sudden motion.
The witness compared the appearance of the object to a simple reflection of a bright metallic object in a glass window.
